qas.question: Who began the new phase of neoclassical design?
Where were the inspirations for the new phase of neoclassicism centered?
What book outlines the new trends of neoclassicism in this phase?
During the later 18th century the trend of neoclassic design attempted to simplify what styles?
This new style was an attempt to give what different feel to design?
What architects traveled Italy and Dalmatia in the mid-seventeenth century?

plausible_answers.text: A new phase in neoclassical design

qas.question: What did Robert and James Adam start in the seventeenth century?
Who was trying to simplify the neoclassical design?
What book outlines the trends of the baroque style?
How did the old-style feel compared to the new style?

context: <b6_0>A new phase in neoclassical design<b6_0/> was inaugurated by <a0_0><b5_0>Robert and James Adam<b5_0/><a0_0/>, who travelled in <a1_0>Italy and Dalmatia<a1_0/> in the 1750s, observing the ruins of the classical world. On their return to Britain, they published a book entitled <a2_0><b8_0>The Works in Architecture<b8_0/><a2_0/> in installments between 1773 and 1779. This book of engraved designs made the Adam repertory available throughout Europe. <b7_0>The Adam brothers<b7_0/> aimed to simplify the <a3_0>rococo and baroque styles<a3_0/> which had been fashionable in the preceding decades, to bring what they felt to be a <a4_0><b9_0>lighter and more elegant feel<b9_0/><a4_0/> to Georgian houses. The Works in Architecture illustrated the main buildings the Adam brothers had worked on and crucially documented the interiors, furniture and fittings, designed by the Adams.
